pr_title: DHFPROD-4894: Stop printing requests/responses on MockMvc test failure

timeline.bodyText: Can you add your comment in this PR to the code here? This is a good example of how convenient annotations can be, but they often beg the question of "Why is this set?" Your comment will be a very useful reminder six months from now when a new developer sees this.
timeline.author: rjrudin
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -25,7 +26,7 @@
  * Similar to AbstractOneUiTest, please be judicious about adding helper methods to this class. Any methods added
  * should be applicable to a wide swath of tests, not just a handful.
  */
-@AutoConfigureMockMvc
+@AutoConfigureMockMvc(print = MockMvcPrint.NONE)

replies.bodyText:
The commit message contains this
DHFPROD-4894: Stop printing requests/responses on MockMvc test failure
There is a bug in MockMvc that causes ConcurrentModificationException
when it tries to read the response headers for async requests in
order to print the response.

Do you mean a code comment?
replies.author: akshaysonvane

replies.bodyText: I think the comment is better placed on the code, not in the PR. PR comments are useful for explaining the scope of a PR, but they're not a good place for describing how a particular line of code works. A reader of this code will see the comment immediately, but may not even think to look for a commit comment.
replies.author: rjrudin

replies.bodyText: Right, I'll add it to the code.
replies.author: akshaysonvane

timeline.message:
DHFPROD-4894: Stop printing requests/responses on MockMvc test failure

There is a bug in MockMvc that causes ConcurrentModificationException
when it tries to read the response headers for async requests in
order to print the response.
